title: Abroad. Journal of a tour through Great Britain and on the Continent
author: Coghill, James Henry.
snippet: It is noted more particularly for the encounter which took place during the reign of James I, between Donald of the Isles and the Earls of Mar and Caithness, in which the latter were defeated and Caithness slain.* The Marquis of Montrose in 1645 achieved here one of his most decisive victories over his great adversary the Marquis of Argyle. After going through and over the ruins, we drove on to Fort AAllliam, where we partook of a lunch at the Caledonia Hotel, for which the price ofa good dinner was charged. We then embarked on the steamer Mountaineer at 4 p.

title: Abroad. Journal of a tour through Great Britain and on the Continent
author: Coghill, James Henry.
snippet: on our return, arriving at Oban at 7 o'clock. AVe stopped at the Caledonia Hotel, where we had a good supper, good beds, and a good night's sleep.
